(also called Riska) is a village of

By bus: Follow line 21 from Sandnes bus- and railway station.
By car: Follow Rv. 13 from Sandnes, leading into Rv. 516.
By boat: From Stavanger harbour (more info on www.kolumbus.no)
Hommersåk is the village of Riska, and is located where the Riska fiord ends.

value: The old wood church, Riska gamle kirke, built 1877.
The old mill, "Kvernhusene i Frøylandsbekken", restored millhouse a few hundred meters from the park Stemmen.
The Skjærgård in summer, contact FjordEvents down at Bryggen and go for some amazing Fjord cruising.
Several nice footpaths lead visitors into the beautiful nature surrounding Hommersåk, which includes Maudlandsgården, Måketjern, Riska beach, Kjølvik and Vårlivarden.
The old ship "MS Riskafjord II" offers cruising on the fiord in the high season.
The shopping mall, Bryggen senter, offers a variety of shops, hairdresser, bakery and a bistro.
There is also some groserie shops including Kiwi,Rimi and Mega
